undergraduate.content: WIU has rolling admission! For Fall, we recommend applying by August 1. For Spring, by November 1. Good news: We are test-optional, meaning SAT/ACT scores are NOT required for undergraduate admission.

international.content: International students are welcome! Application deadlines are April 1 for Fall semester and October 1 for Spring semester. You will need to check English proficiency requirements.

transfer.content: Transferring is seamless at WIU. If you have completed at least 24 semester hours, apply as a transfer student. Recommended deadlines: August 1 (Fall) and December 1 (Spring).

data_science.content: WIU offers programs in Data Science and Business Analytics as part of its School of Computer Sciences. Check the catalog for specific course codes.

biology.content: The Department of Biological Sciences includes concentrations in Botany, Microbiology, and Zoology.

general.content: Western Illinois University offers over 120 majors and 35+ graduate programs. We have a 12:1 Student-to-Faculty ratio!

tuition_in_state.content: At WIU, there is NO out-of-state tuition premium! Everyone pays the in-state rate, regardless of where they live.

tuition_out_of_state.content: Good news: Out-of-state students pay the EXACT SAME rate as in-state students. We don't charge extra for crossing state lines.

scholarships.content: Our 'Western Way' program covers all tuition and mandatory fees for eligible students. The average financial aid award is $19,000!

housing.content: Experience Leatherneck life! We have comfortable residence halls and lively green spaces. Freshmen typically live on campus.

sports.content: WIU Athletics (The Leathernecks) compete in NCAA Division I. We offer Football, Basketball, Soccer, and more.

mental_health.content: We offer robust mental health resources, including the University Counseling Center and emergency support.
